title: How Two Cities Joined Together
photoPrompt: Visit the retired fire station in person - what things still look like a fire station? What things definitely don't?
blurb: Learn how the city of Ballard became a part of Seattle, and about one of the last remaining structures from historic Ballard, Fire Station No. 18.

stickers.title: Horse-drawn fire engine rushing to a fire
Aerial view of the Ballard neighborhood north of downtown Seattle, Washington, along Elliott Bay
Aerial view of Seattle, Washington, with a focus on the Hiram M. Chittenden Locks, or Ballard Locks, a complex of locks at the west end of Salmon Bay and the Lake Washington Ship Canal
Photo shows nine men standing with a very long driftwood sculpture of a sea serpent on a beach in the Ballard area of Seattle, Washington.
